description:
We highly recommend following along with the tutorial on UM-Bridge docs: https://um-bridge-benchmarks.readthedocs.io/en/docs/tutorial.html

Treating uncertainties is essential in the design of safe aircraft, medical decision making, and many other fields. UM-Bridge enables straightforward uncertainty quantification (UQ) on advanced models by removing technical barriers.

Complex numerical models often consist of large code bases that are difficult to integrate with UQ packages such as PyMC, holding back many interesting applications. UM-Bridge is a universal interface for linking UQ and models, greatly accelerating development from prototype to high-performance computing.

This hands-on tutorial teaches participants how to build UQ applications using PyMC and UM-Bridge. We cover a range of practical exercises ranging from basic toy examples all the way to controlling parallelized models on a live cloud cluster. Beyond that, we encourage participants to bring their own methods and problems.

📝 Check out the tutorial slides here: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ccw1Qs0JiHTYKCDFJncaHPwJF2_n27xS/view?usp=sharing
Code: https://um-bridge-benchmarks.readthedocs.io/en/docs/tutorial.html

Give it a try now, and don't forget to RSVP for their upcoming Q&A session to explore more about Uncertainty Quantification (UQ) and UM-Bridge. 🤓🔍

🔗 Register for the upcoming Q&A sessions:
1. For AMER regions (29th Jan at 15:00 UTC)👉 https://www.meetup.com/pymc-online-meetup/events/298279180/
2. For Asia regions (30th Jan at 06:30 UTC)👉 https://www.meetup.com/pymc-online-meetup/events/298356399/

📌 For more information 👇
🔗 PyMCon Website: https://pymcon.com/events/
👉 Discourse Post for more details and discussion: https://discourse.pymc.io/t/13583


📢 PyMCon is a community conference that shares the latest in statistical practices, tricks, and tips. Submit your proposal for the PyMCon Web Series CFP and be part of this exciting community. 🔗 Submit your proposal here: https://pymcon.com/cfp/ 

📩 Join the PyMCon mailing list to stay up-to-date on the latest news, insights, and announcements. 🔗 Join the mailing list here: https://dashboard.mailerlite.com/forms/241188/73241617305175542/share

title: PyMCon Web Series - Enabling Uncertainty Quantification | Anne Reinarz & Linus Seelinger | Tutorial
